LORD.notes: Often rendered in small capitals in English translations

famine.definition: A severe shortage of food resulting in hunger
famine.notes: Often seen as divine judgment or testing in biblical narratives

judges.definition: Leaders who governed Israel before the monarchy
judges.notes: Period characterized by cycles of sin, oppression, and deliverance

Moab.definition: A nation east of the Dead Sea, often hostile to Israel
Moab.notes: Descendants of Lot through his elder daughter

Bethlehem.definition: City in Judah, means 'house of bread'
Bethlehem.notes: Birthplace of King David and later Jesus

kindness.definition: Hebrew 'chesed' - loyal love, faithfulness, covenant loyalty
kindness.notes: A key theme in Ruth, describing both human and divine loyalty

daughters-in-law.notes: Important family relationship in ancient Near Eastern culture

Ephrathites.definition: People from the region of Ephrath, another name for Bethlehem
Ephrathites.notes: Indicates their specific clan or regional identity

rest.definition: Security and provision, especially through marriage
rest.notes: In Ruth's context, refers to finding a secure home

redeem.definition: To buy back or restore through payment
redeem.notes: Central to the kinsman-redeemer concept in Ruth
